AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: referred to as the Government, party in the legal case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court: held a hearing and entered an opinion and order in Federico Saldana's case, reviewed testimony about drug alerts in a vehicle search, protects individuals from unreasonable searches and seizures, makes reasonable suspicion inquiries based on the totality of circumstances
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office: Employer of detectives Gary Haston, Heather Vargas, and Deputy Jason Cox, involved in drug interdiction cases and utilized a K-9 unit for searches, conducted investigation at a tire shop, participated in traffic stops and vehicle searches on Interstate 35, engaged in detention and questioning of individuals during traffic stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox: Deputy who initiated the traffic stop on Interstate 35 and handled paperwork for the stop, participated in searching vehicles and retrieving cocaine, had an objectively reasonable suspicion of multiple traffic violations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: Detective involved in providing traffic violation information and present at the scene after the stop, participated in searching vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: Individual stopped by Jason Cox, admitted to prior arrests for smuggling illegal aliens and drugs, served 9 years in federal prison, arrested for transporting cocaine, moved to suppress the cocaine under his rights, exhibited unsafe driving behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: Detective who interrogated Federico Saldana about potential drug trafficking and conducted searches with a K-9 unit, retrieved cocaine from the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer, witnessed and reported traffic violations
